page.title: 11The Welsh Language
page.content: Although English is the most important language of the area, there is now a revival of Welsh. A growing awareness of, and interest in, the language in recent years has led to the develop- ment of Welsh medium education. Gwent L.E.A. makes no pre-school provision in Welsh, but in Risca there is a flourishing Welsh playgroup run by enthusiastic volunteers, most of whom are themselves Welsh learners. As a consequence of this activity, Welsh units are being set up in primary schools. No secondary schools locally offer Welsh, apart from a Link Course in which Risca Comprehensive pupils attend Crosskeys College. This has created a demand for "O" and "A" Level Welsh at the College. There has also been a large increase in the number of Welsh classes at Adult Education Centres in recent years.
